meanings.definition: A person who casts or is entitled to cast a vote.
meanings.sent1: The balloters lined up outside the polling station to vote.
meanings.sent2: The balloters in the community had the opportunity to participate in the election.
meanings.sent3: The balloters decided to have a friendly competition to see who could vote the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The balloters were the stars of the show, each vote shining brightly like a beacon.
meanings.sent5: The balloters proudly exercised their right to vote, making their voices heard.

meanings.definition: A group of people eligible to vote in an election.
meanings.sent1: The balloters gathered at the town hall to discuss the upcoming election.
meanings.sent2: The balloters were eager to make their voices heard on election day.
meanings.sent3: The balloters formed a club where they discussed voting strategies over tea and cookies.
meanings.sent4: The balloters stood united, a force to be reckoned with in the democratic process.
meanings.sent5: The balloters were like a flock of birds, each one adding their unique color to the election landscape.
